segments.content: (aka WHISKEY BAY)
Written by
Jonathan Hirschbein
TEXT OVER BLACK: "Before all else, be armed"
- Niccolo Machiavelli

A rusted Chevy El Camino drives against dissolving Louisiana

            landscapes - broad, barren, pounded by the rain.

Occasional oncoming headlights illuminate the driver's face:

            Tense, course features, thick beard... He's BUD CARTER, 31.

heading.subject: AN INTERSTATE SIGN PASSES ON THE RIGHT: "WHISKEY BAY"
heading.raw_text: AN INTERSTATE SIGN PASSES ON THE RIGHT: "WHISKEY BAY"

segments.content: Bud pulls onto a dirt road, into a TRAILER PARK and stops.

TITLE IN: Denham Springs, Louisiana. 1983.

            We're staring at three sacks of sample unmounted EMERALDS,

            set on a filthy counter.
Now these here are Brazilian, from Bahia.
Deep cuts. Damn good. These is India,
paler, but also good. And this is
Columbia. From them limestone caves up in
WIDEN to reveal NADY GRACE, 35. A tattooed man with thinning hair, leading Bud through the sale...

dialogue.text: WIDEN to reveal NADY GRACE, 35. A tattooed man with thinning hair, leading Bud through the sale...

segments.content: Now them first two, you gonna get your
money's worth.
(re: COLUMBIA EMERALDS)
This one here's more expensive, but
that's 'cause there ain't a nigger flaw
in one of 'em. They hard as steel and
emerald green as emerald green fuckin'
comes. Lookit that.
That's nice.
That's the real McCoy. That's what that
is.
Tell you what... Bag 'em all. The
market's got a hard-on for this shit.
I hear that.
(across the room)

ACROSS THE ROOM are two other men -- JAKE and DOUG. Ex-cons at a table, riffing through Bud's cash. A CURTAIN YANKS BACK and RAY WHEELER, 29, enters. Dope-thin, bloodshot eyes. He looks at Bud. Bud looks at him... Ray clicks on the TV and opens a beer. TV IN: Evening news. The storm outside alters the reception.

dialogue.text: ACROSS THE ROOM are two other men -- JAKE and DOUG. Ex-cons at a table, riffing through Bud's cash. A CURTAIN YANKS BACK and RAY WHEELER, 29, enters. Dope-thin, bloodshot eyes. He looks at Bud. Bud looks at him... Ray clicks on the TV and opens a beer. TV IN: Evening news. The storm outside alters the reception.

segments.content: ...And today, thirty-one year old Gary
Plauche pleaded innocent by reason of
insanity, to charges of second-degree
murder in the slaying of accused sex
offender, Jeffrey Doucett.
Bud watches Ray empty a gram of coke onto the bar. Using a
credit card, Ray starts chopping lines. The SOUND continues
throughout the scene...
...District Court Judge Frank Salia,
scheduled the trial one year to the day
after Doucett was first arrested.
Grace hefts a lock box to the counter, removes a drawer of
emeralds. Bud SEES packed carelessly underneath, uncut
What do you got there? Diamonds?
That's thirty grand. Out the door. You
interested?
Ain't got the scratch right now. But I am
interested.
And the volume of the TV now becomes more apparent...
...As a result of numerous threats made
weeks ago, tight security surrounded the
courthouse. However, missing from today's
hearing, was the arresting officer.
Bud has been tuning out the TV distraction... until that last
statement. He sneaks a look.
A wave of static scrambles the picture. When it clears...

character.name: From East Baton Rouge Sheriff's office...

dialogue.text: A wave of static scrambles the picture. When it clears...

segments.content: ...Police Lieutenant, Bud Carter.
Bud is stunned. HIS OWN FACE APPEARS ON THE SCREEN. A younger
photo of Bud, clean shaven - DRESSED IN POLICE UNIFORM.
Rain pours. A beat-up PLUMBER'S VAN is parked in the distance.

TV IN: Signal wavers. It's archive footage of Baton Rouge

            Airport. A prisoner, JEFFREY DOUCETT, escorted by police.
Doucett was being extradited to Baton

Ray does a line of coke, keeps chopping. Watches the TV. Grace is bagging emeralds. Jake and Doug count cash. Bud keeps the TV in sight. Quick glances. Mind racing. TV IN: The procession moves past a row of pay phones. At one phone, a discreet figure, GARY PLAUCHE, turns...

dialogue.text: Ray does a line of coke, keeps chopping. Watches the TV. Grace is bagging emeralds. Jake and Doug count cash. Bud keeps the TV in sight. Quick glances. Mind racing. TV IN: The procession moves past a row of pay phones. At one phone, a discreet figure, GARY PLAUCHE, turns...

segments.content: The victim's father, Gary Plauche, stood
waiting at the terminal. As Doucett
walked by, Plauche turned, raised a
handgun...and fired.
Bud's vision is suddenly obscured when Grace steps forward
with the emeralds in a satchel.
Here you go. Fifteen three-karat blues.
Sudden GUNSHOTS and SCREAMS on the TV. Everyone turns... TV IN: Jeffrey Doucett lies dead as POLICE wrestle Gary Plauche to the ground amid chaos.

dialogue.text: Sudden GUNSHOTS and SCREAMS on the TV. Everyone turns... TV IN: Jeffrey Doucett lies dead as POLICE wrestle Gary Plauche to the ground amid chaos.

segments.content: Lieutenant Carter was unavailable for
comment.
TIGHT ON RAY'S EYES, intense, watching the footage.
As Bud stuffs the satchel in his coat, WE SEE what Ray
sees...
TV IN: Bud, POLICE BADGE AROUND HIS NECK, arresting Plauche.
ON RAY, slow burn realization as he looks from the tv to Bud.
And again. EYES LOCK, THEY BOTH KNOW.

Bud yanks a .45. And everything happens at once. A SUDDEN GUNSHOT and Jake FIRES again. Wood splinters as Bud FIRES back. Jake is HIT in the throat. A SECOND SHOT in the forehead - he SLAMS against the window, cracking it... INT. PLUMBER'S VAN - SAME Among surveillance equipment, sits Bud's crew: TODD SHEPARD, DAVID MARANDINO and DALE COBB. Gunshots ECHO.

dialogue.text: Bud yanks a .45. And everything happens at once. A SUDDEN GUNSHOT and Jake FIRES again. Wood splinters as Bud FIRES back. Jake is HIT in the throat. Gunshots ECHO.

segments.content: Marandino, behind the wheel, SLAMS his foot on the gas. INT. GRACE'S TRAILER - SAME A SHOT ZIPS across Bud's back; he SPINS off the table. On his knees, Doug is firing a .32. BLAM BLAM BLAM BLAM. Bud FIRES a burst through Doug's chest, dropping him. A HOLE EXPLODES beside Bud's head -- Grace FIRING a .45 -- as Ray SCREAMS and runs out the door. EXT. TRAILER PARK, VAN - SAME Marandino winds through gears, as Ray hits the yard running... POV THROUGH THE WINDSHIELD: Marandino swings the wheel hard, SLAMS INTO RAY -- launching him through trash bins, into the mud. Cobb jumps from the van and pounds Ray into handcuffs. Simultaneously, Shepard sprints for the trailer door... EXT. GRACE'S TRAILER PARK - SAME Grace explodes from the back door, bolting across the yard. I/E. GRACE'S TRAILER - SAME Bud scrambles on the floor of the demolished trailer. .45 held tight, he runs out after Grace. ACROSS THE YARD the chase rages. MOVING WITH GRACE as he jumps a link fence, lands and trips into a roll of chicken wire. His sleeve catches, rips as he pulls free... MOVING WITH BUD at a searing pace. He slips in the mud. Staggers up. SEES Grace disappear in the shadows. Grace throws himself against the side of a power unit. Eyes darting. Wheezing hard... Tries to slow his breath. Then turns the corner... GRACE'S POV: A SHOVEL swings from around the corner, WHAM!!! The blow sends Grace sailing back. He SLAMS on the ground, with a blood-covered broken face. As he tries to get up... Bud's gun is there. And like that, it stops. INT. SOUTHDOWN'S BAR - AFTER HOURS At a table, the METRO SQUAD: Bud, Shepard, Marandino, Cobb are drinking. A bartender (SHERRY) is wiping down glasses...

And like that, it stops. INT. SOUTHDOWN'S BAR - AFTER HOURS At a table, the METRO SQUAD: Bud, Shepard, Marandino, Cobb are drinking. A bartender (SHERRY) is wiping down glasses...

segments.content: Think I broke a knuckle on that guy's
tooth.
He only had one tooth.
Well I got it, didn't I?
(to the bartender)
Another round, Sherry.
Bud blows smoke, distant from the others.

dialogue.text: Bud blows smoke, distant from the others.

segments.content: Bud, we all supposed to be celebratin'.
'Been workin' this case for months. And
you ain't said shit.
They had a lot of weight. Too much.
It's a ring. Organized burglary.
You saw them guys. You think that half
ass crew was organized?
(laughs)
They shit their pants in unison.
What are you gettin' after, Bud?
Sherry arrives with shots of whiskey, moves on.

character.name: You think it was someone else's score.

dialogue.text: Sherry arrives with shots of whiskey, moves on.

segments.content: Bud takes his shot.

character.name: I think its a part of somethin' bigger.

dialogue.text: Bud takes his shot.

segments.content: Tomorrow morning we put our friends under
the lamp. If they know this "someone
else", we'll know him too.

heading.subject: ABLISH
heading.raw_text: EXT. EAST BATON ROUGE PARISH JAIL - ESTABLISH - NEXT DAY

segments.content: A dark, stone monolith off the 110 highway.

locations: OBSERVATION ROOM, EAST BATON ROUGE PARISH JAIL
heading.raw_text: INT. OBSERVATION ROOM, EAST BATON ROUGE PARISH JAIL - DAY

segments.content:
Bud smokes, standing with Shepard in semi-darkness. They're

            looking through a two-way mirror into an INTERROGATION ROOM,

            where Cobb interviews Ray Wheeler.
I told you... I keep tellin' you... I
don't know nothin'. That's it.
That's not it. We've been here all
morning. We'll stay here all night.
Bud paces to a neighboring INTERROGATION ROOM where Marandino
is questioning Grace (bruised face, swollen, broken nose).
The stones you were fencin' belonged to
an Amsec wall safe in "Kay's Jewelers".
The rest from a vault in Bocage. Both
owners can verify their belongings, and
have.
(beat)
Who you fencin' for?
Man, I ain't sayin' fuckin' shit.
Then your name's on a dozen other jobs,
just like it.
That's bullshit.
Bud, sipping coffee, paces back to Ray's interview...

dialogue.text: Bud, sipping coffee, paces back to Ray's interview...

segments.content: We got a series of burglaries in the
area. All over the last six months. All
still open. You don't talk, it's on you.
Well I ain't got nothin' to do with that.
Any idea who does?
Bud sets down his coffee, calm. INT. GRACE'S INTERROGATION ROOM Marandino sits across from Grace, clearly frustrated.

dialogue.text: Bud sets down his coffee, calm. INT. GRACE'S INTERROGATION ROOM Marandino sits across from Grace, clearly frustrated.

segments.content: ...Answer the question.
(exploding)

heading.subject: MAN FUCK THIS! AND FUCK YOU! Y'ALL CREW'S
heading.raw_text: MAN FUCK THIS! AND FUCK YOU! Y'ALL CREW'S

segments.content:
The door blasts open. Bud charges in, throws Grace against

            the wall, then slams his face onto the table, pushing down.
Try this. I know you're too fuckin' dumb
to be any more than a courier. I know
you're coverin' for someone else. NOW

heading.subject: TELL ME WHO THAT SOMEONE IS!
heading.raw_text: TELL ME WHO THAT SOMEONE IS!

segments.content: I ain't a rat!
Bud twists his broken nose. Grace SCREAMS.
Easy, Bud. Go easy.
(to Marandino)
Marandino puts a hand on Bud's shoulder; Bud shoves him off.

Marandino locks it. Bud turns Grace's nose even harder,

            nearly rips it off his face.
I'll teach you what commitment is... I'll
throw you in an eight by nine and have
you fucked in the ass by every inmate in
the state of Louisiana-- AND THAT'S THE
Grace, spitting blood now. Choking. Bud twists. Bone cracks.
(hacking)
He's from Whiskey Bay--!

Raining.

            An unmarked chevy is staked down the block from a tract home.
INT. CHEVY - NIGHT Bud's in the front seat, looking through a file. Shepard at the wheel. Coffee cups and junk food litter the dash.

dialogue.text: INT. CHEVY - NIGHT Bud's in the front seat, looking through a file. Shepard at the wheel. Coffee cups and junk food litter the dash.

segments.content: Two tours in 'Nam. '69 and '71. He's a
jump marine. Weapons trained, explosives.
(turns the page)
Seven and a half out of a twelve year
stint for federal robbery. Two in Angola.
A year in DeQuincy. Three in El Reno with
a transfer to Lewisburg. Then Marion with
a brief stopover in Leavenworth. Released
from Oxford, 1981.
Through the windshield, across the street, a tract home they're watching.

character.name: Jacket's the size of the bible.

dialogue.text: Through the windshield, across the street, a tract home they're watching.

segments.content: His stay at Marion, they kept him in "H"
block.
H block? That's home to forty top murder
one inmates...
Yeah, life sentences. Jesse only had
twelve years.
Bud likes it.
He ain't just woodwork.
Night passes and the dawn arrives...

Front door opens and the shadowy figure of JESSE WHEELER,

            whose face we cannot see, emerges.
(waking Bud)
Jesse fires up his '74 battered green PICK-UP TRUCK. He backs from the driveway and proceeds down the street.

dialogue.text: Jesse fires up his '74 battered green PICK-UP TRUCK. He backs from the driveway and proceeds down the street.

segments.content: (into radio)
Bud's car starts and we move off with them...

dialogue.text: Bud's car starts and we move off with them...

segments.content: (into radio)

EXT. STREETS - MINUTES LATER In the rain, Bud and Shepard tail Jesse from a distance. They pass an alley where a waiting BUICK falls in behind the Chevy; Marandino and Cobb are inside. INT. CHEVY - CONTINUOUS - THROUGH THE WINDSHIELD: We see the truck slowing, angling into a TEXACO STATION.

dialogue.text: EXT. STREETS - MINUTES LATER In the rain, Bud and Shepard tail Jesse from a distance. They pass an alley where a waiting BUICK falls in behind the Chevy; Marandino and Cobb are inside. INT. CHEVY - CONTINUOUS - THROUGH THE WINDSHIELD: We see the truck slowing, angling into a TEXACO STATION.

segments.content: He's turnin' off.
Let's take him in the car.
(into radio)
Wait'll he's stopped. Watch your
backgrounds.

heading.raw_text: INT. JESSE'S PICK UP - MOMENTS LATER

segments.content: Jesse stops at a pump. Suddenly, Bud appears at the window

heading.subject: a SHOTGUN against Jesse's head.
heading.raw_text: and jams a SHOTGUN against Jesse's head.

segments.content: Don't move. You motherfuck, I'll blow
your head clean off.
Reflecting in the side-view: Bud's BADGE swings from his
neck. Jesse's eyes resign to relief. Bud SEES this...
With several law enforcement shotguns now leveled at him from all directions, Jesse turns off his engine.

dialogue.text: With several law enforcement shotguns now leveled at him from all directions, Jesse turns off his engine.

heading.subject: s and shotguns, move in
heading.raw_text: Bud, Shepard, Cobb and Marandino, vests and shotguns, move in

segments.content:
unison around the house.

            Bud and Cobb stay to the shadows, down a side yard...

            Shepard, Marandino reach the front door. Locked. A tv plays

            quietly inside. No one in the windows. 

            Shepard signals to Marandino...

THE FRONT DOOR IS KICKED DOWN. Shepard and Marandino spill

            in, guns ready...

A pregnant woman in the kitchen... LYNN WHEELER, 30s. She

            SCREAMS, curses. Hurling dirty dishes fly like frisbees.

heading.subject: GET OUT! GET THE FUCK OUT OF MY HOUSE!
heading.raw_text: GET OUT! GET THE FUCK OUT OF MY HOUSE!

segments.content: (more dishes)

Lynn suddenly gasps agitatedly, sinks to the floor. A GUSH OF

            FLUID soaks through her dress.
Bud and Cobb enter from a back door, hurry towards Lynn. Bud lowers Lynn to the floor.

dialogue.text: Bud and Cobb enter from a back door, hurry towards Lynn. Bud lowers Lynn to the floor.

segments.content: (to Cobb)

A door slams open to reveal...

            A NAZI IRON EAGLE BATTLE FLAG. Draped across the far wall.

            Windows taped over. Walls painted black.

            Military surplus on every shelf and surface. Helmets.

            Uniforms. Body armor. Bayonets.

            Bud in the doorway. Shepard joins him.
Toss everything.

Several COPS(now on scene) ransack the house. Ripping open

            cabinets, drawers, tossing everything to the floor...
Cobb flips a switch. A lamp illuminates a workbench.

Cabinets, lockers and tool boxes slam open. Cops stop cold, blown away by what they see: GUNS. Everywhere. LIVING ROOM COP #1 feels behind a couch. He finds a .38, then a COLT .25 below a chair cushion. BATHROOM COP #2 removes the toilet's basin cover. With a pen, he removes a dripping .357. KITCHEN Several STATE TROOPERS lead Jesse in, cuff him to a table. ATTIC Floor peels back. Flashlights illuminate: AMMUNITION BOXES. ASSAULT RIFLES. GRENADES. BONDS and COUNTERFEIT PLATES.

dialogue.text: Cabinets, lockers and tool boxes slam open. Cops stop cold, blown away by what they see: GUNS. Everywhere. LIVING ROOM COP #1 feels behind a couch. He finds a .38, then a COLT .25 below a chair cushion. BATHROOM COP #2 removes the toilet's basin cover. With a pen, he removes a dripping .357. KITCHEN Several STATE TROOPERS lead Jesse in, cuff him to a table. ATTIC Floor peels back. Flashlights illuminate: AMMUNITION BOXES. ASSAULT RIFLES. GRENADES. BONDS and COUNTERFEIT PLATES.

segments.content: LIVING ROOM Cops talk excitedly over one another. Shepard leans over a mounted A.C. He finds a string and very slowly pulls up a ziploc bag filled with DIAMONDS.

dialogue.text: LIVING ROOM Cops talk excitedly over one another. Shepard leans over a mounted A.C. He finds a string and very slowly pulls up a ziploc bag filled with DIAMONDS.

segments.content: KITCHEN Bud takes a seat at the table... For the first time, we get a good look at Jesse Wheeler: Cold eyes. Handlebar mustache. Covered in tats. With a boilermaker's build, he looks what he is... DANGEROUS.

dialogue.text: KITCHEN Bud takes a seat at the table... For the first time, we get a good look at Jesse Wheeler: Cold eyes. Handlebar mustache. Covered in tats. With a boilermaker's build, he looks what he is... DANGEROUS.

segments.content: I'm Detective Lieutenant Bud Carter, of
the East Baton Rouge Parish Precinct.
(smiles)
Jesse's stare drifts to Bud. It's deadly. Cabinets slam open and closed. Dishes hit the floor.

character.name: So how you like Baton Rouge?

dialogue.text: Jesse's stare drifts to Bud. It's deadly. Cabinets slam open and closed. Dishes hit the floor.

segments.content: What happened to my wife?
Water broke. She's en route to the
hospital.
COP #3 is searching the refrigerator. Jesse watches as if
he's seen something we haven't... Cop #3 moves on...
Jesse sees Bud's eyes. They connect with his own...
Bud opens the fridge. He scans condiments then stops. From
inside a bag of HOT DOG BUNS, several sealed VIALS.
Bud examines a vial's label: "CYANIDE."

dialogue.text: Bud examines a vial's label: "CYANIDE."

segments.content: What's the cyanide for, Jesse?
Bud, right with him, grins.

dialogue.text: Bud, right with him, grins.

segments.content: Jesse, calm. Deadpan.

dialogue.text: Jesse, calm. Deadpan.

segments.content: You're in a bad situation here, pal.

Bud looks in Jesse's eyes and believes it. BEDROOM Shepard, searching the room. Drawers, cabinets. Then leans down to peer under the bed... ...stops, stunned when he SEES: a row of live Goex charges in packing, boldly marked: EXPLOSIVES

dialogue.text: Bud looks in Jesse's eyes and believes it. BEDROOM Shepard, searching the room. Drawers, cabinets. Then leans down to peer under the bed... ...stops, stunned when he SEES: a row of live Goex charges in packing, boldly marked: EXPLOSIVES

segments.content: (top of his lungs)

heading.subject: OUT! EVERYONE OUT! GET THE FUCK OUT!
heading.raw_text: OUT! EVERYONE OUT! GET THE FUCK OUT!

locations: CAPTAIN'S OFFICE, EAST BATON ROUGE PARISH PRECINCT
heading.raw_text: INT. CAPTAIN'S OFFICE, EAST BATON ROUGE PARISH PRECINCT - DAY

segments.content:
MIKE BRADDOCK (40s), Captain of Detectives, enters his

            office. Bud tows, carrying files.
What more do you want? You got a two time
felon on multiple counts. You got
robbery, B&E, you got an all-you-can-eat
felony fuckin' possession. All on top of
an organized burglary ring.

locations: PROCESSING ROOM, EAST BATON ROUGE PARISH PRISON
heading.raw_text: INT. PROCESSING ROOM, EAST BATON ROUGE PARISH PRISON - DAY

heading.subject: ON A CAMERA FLASH. Mug shots of Jesse's front and profile.
heading.raw_text: ON A CAMERA FLASH. Mug shots of Jesse's front and profile.

segments.content: The man's in custody, Bud. Fucked for
life. It's finished.
Jesse's inked fingers are rolled onto an exemplar sheet.

locations: CAPTAIN'S OFFICE, EAST BATON ROUGE PARISH PRECINCT
heading.raw_text: INT. CAPTAIN'S OFFICE, EAST BATON ROUGE PARISH PRECINCT - DAY

segments.content: Bud slaps a file on Braddock's desk, to a crime scene photo: An Asian JUDGE sits dead in the front seat of his car.

dialogue.text: Bud slaps a file on Braddock's desk, to a crime scene photo: An Asian JUDGE sits dead in the front seat of his car.

segments.content: Remember him? Ten months ago, a judge
gets popped with a .357. Well I got a
Ruger from Wheeler's toilet and rushed it
through ballistics.
And?
It's a solid match! Dead on.
There's a dozen ways Wheeler could've got
that burner. It don't prove a thing.
(drops another file)
A stack of bonds taken from the home of a
The crime photo: A black MINISTER and wife shot in bed.

dialogue.text: The crime photo: A black MINISTER and wife shot in bed.

segments.content: Murdered. He and his wife. Looked like a
robbery gone to shit then; I want it
opened back up.

locations: ANTE ROOM, EAST BATON ROUGE PARISH PRISON
heading.raw_text: INT. ANTE ROOM, EAST BATON ROUGE PARISH PRISON - DAY

segments.content: A nude Jesse steps before a DOCTOR and gets a cursory exam.
I still got tests pending. More guns.
More cases. This guy ain't crazy, Mike.
He's a ticket to somethin' big. Somethin'
happening now.

locations: CAPTAIN'S OFFICE, EAST BATON ROUGE PARISH PRECINCT
heading.raw_text: INT. CAPTAIN'S OFFICE, EAST BATON ROUGE PARISH PRECINCT - DAY

segments.content: Meanwhile...
So who's backin' him?
I don't know; I do know they'll post his
bond. That's why I need a price they
can't come up with overnight.
Braddock listens. Bud keeps it on track...
I'm right about this, Mike.
(leans close)
When a guy's lookin' at two hundred years
and he ain't upset... It's like when your
wife is accusing you of fuckin' the
neighbor, but she don't know you're
fuckin' her sister too. You're pretty
calm about it, right?
Braddock smiles slightly.
It's 'cause we hit the wrong nerve. The
guns, the other shit, the time... He can
have that conversation. And he is. And he
ain't upset. He's makin' eye contact,
'cause we're fallin' short.
(the bottom line)
This guy knows things. He knows where
bodies are.
Braddock, thinks; Then--

Bud grins, SLAMS his hand on the desk. INT. HOLDING AREA, EAST BATON ROUGE PARISH PRISON - DUSK Two GUARDS escort Jesse. He's bound in chains, orange scrubs. INT. HOLDING CELL End of the hall. A BLACK PRISONER waits, arms slung over the crossbars with a cigarette. Jesse is brought forth. A Guard unlocks the cell. The Black Prisoner steps back, joining TWO OTHERS: All black, looming in the darkness. Jesse steps in. Guards unlock his shackles. Chains hit the floor. Behind him, the bars slam home. SILENCE...LONG, DRAWN SILENCE. THEN:

character.name: I'll bounce it up to the D.A.

dialogue.text: Bud grins, SLAMS his hand on the desk. INT. HOLDING AREA, EAST BATON ROUGE PARISH PRISON - DUSK Two GUARDS escort Jesse. He's bound in chains, orange scrubs. INT. HOLDING CELL End of the hall. A BLACK PRISONER waits, arms slung over the crossbars with a cigarette. Jesse is brought forth. A Guard unlocks the cell. The Black Prisoner steps back, joining TWO OTHERS: All black, looming in the darkness. Jesse steps in. Guards unlock his shackles. Chains hit the floor. Behind him, the bars slam home. SILENCE...LONG, DRAWN SILENCE. THEN:

segments.content: My name is Jesse Wheeler... I'm now in
charge of this cell. Any y'all don't like
it, step your black ass forward, line up.
A MOMENT. Cued by Jesse's challenge, each of the prisoners
slowly rise, vehemently approaching...
And the phone RINGS...
(answers)
Yeah...
WIDEN. Bud's house is sparsely furnished. Books on firearms and police work in stacks. As he reaches for a file...

dialogue.text: WIDEN. Bud's house is sparsely furnished. Books on firearms and police work in stacks. As he reaches for a file...

segments.content: (into phone)
Charlie... You had an inmate in '75,
named Jesse Wheeler.

heading.raw_text: INT. OFFICE, MARION PENITENTIARY, ILLINOIS - NIGHT

segments.content: CHARLIE BOWERS, on an official phone. At Jesse's name, he's
Charlie, you there?
What's your interest in this guy, Bud?
Well, we got him on weapons and burglary.
But I got a feelin' there's more.
Damn straight, a lot more. Race riots.
Smuggling. Extorting a guard. I had a few
run-ins with him myself.
INT. BEDROOM, BUD'S HOUSE - PRE DAWN Bud lies in bed, wide awake. The PHONE CONVERSATION carries over...

dialogue.text: INT. BEDROOM, BUD'S HOUSE - PRE DAWN Bud lies in bed, wide awake. The PHONE CONVERSATION carries over...

segments.content: KITCHEN - DAWN Coffee pours into a mug. Then a shot of Irish Whiskey.

character.name: You could say this is where he peaked.

dialogue.text: KITCHEN - DAWN Coffee pours into a mug. Then a shot of Irish Whiskey.

segments.content: He's a white supremacist. The worst kind,
if there is one.
Bud, dressed now. The table is covered with various reports
and photos from Jesse's file. BUD'S EYES guide us through...
Bud picks up a photo: Jesse's Angola mug shot, age 23.

character.name: Came in on armed robbery and assault...

dialogue.text: Bud picks up a photo: Jesse's Angola mug shot, age 23.

segments.content: But word in the system said, he's a
contract killer for the Aryan
Photos of Jesse's tattoos: SUN-WHEEL on the shoulder; HELL HOUNDS around the biceps, THOR'S ELAPID covering his back.

dialogue.text: Photos of Jesse's tattoos: SUN-WHEEL on the shoulder; HELL HOUNDS around the biceps, THOR'S ELAPID covering his back.

segments.content: INT. BUD'S CAR, TRAVELING - MORNING Bud's face goes in and out of light and shadow.

character.name: In here, the guy became an organizer...

dialogue.text: INT. BUD'S CAR, TRAVELING - MORNING Bud's face goes in and out of light and shadow.

segments.content: Controlling hits and movements inside the
system. Prison to prison. State to state.

locations: LOWER FLOOR, EAST BATON ROUGE PARISH PRISON
heading.raw_text: INT. LOWER FLOOR, EAST BATON ROUGE PARISH PRISON - MORNING

segments.content: Bud is walking with MURPHY, captain of the guards...
Between the Aryan Brotherhood and Neo
Bud and Murphy descend steps to a grim CORRIDOR.

dialogue.text: Bud and Murphy descend steps to a grim CORRIDOR.

segments.content: All them prison gangs in the world...
Black Panthers, Mexican Mafia, forget it.
The AB is deadly as it gets. And Jesse
The PHONE CONVERSATION fades out... Presently:

dialogue.text: The PHONE CONVERSATION fades out... Presently:

segments.content: So what the fuck happened?
Processing ain't open till morning. We
threw him in holding last night. 'Fore we
even turn around, it's like we're back in
the fuckin' Alamo.
He attack the guards?
Guards are fine. But he took on three
niggers like they stole from him.
Murphy stops outside a solid steel door.
I'll tell you somethin', Bud. After it
happened, our block was the quietest it'd
ever been. Wish we had ten just like him.
INT. ISOLATION CELL - CONTINUOUS Bud enters. Murphy shuts the door and a series of locks BOLT. We're in a stone closet. No bed or sink. No light.

dialogue.text: INT. ISOLATION CELL - CONTINUOUS Bud enters. Murphy shuts the door and a series of locks BOLT. We're in a stone closet. No bed or sink. No light.

segments.content: Jesse's bruised face moves through shadow.

character.name: Heard you refused a public defender.

dialogue.text: Jesse's bruised face moves through shadow.

segments.content: At the gas station...When you were
arrested, I put a gun to your head.
You expected someone else.
You don't look like cops.
And your house? Guns. Mass supply tells
me, intent to sell. Cyanide in the
fridge, explosives...tells me you're
scared.
Jesse's eyes emerge from the dark. Bud, looking right at him.
I know who you are.
If you knew that much, you wouldn't be in
here alone.
Bud smiles and walks to the door.
One more thing, pal. I saw the judge this
morning.
(grins)
HOLD on Jesse. Bud BANGS on the door. Locks UNLATCH. The door opens and Bud steps calmly out to the hall... The door shuts with a BOOM, locking Jesse in. And the nail in the coffin resonates.

dialogue.text: HOLD on Jesse. Bud BANGS on the door. Locks UNLATCH. The door opens and Bud steps calmly out to the hall... The door shuts with a BOOM, locking Jesse in. And the nail in the coffin resonates.

segments.content: Dim and desolate.

heading.raw_text: INT. LOBBY, GREYHOUND STATION - LATE NIGHT

segments.content: Grace buys a ticket, crosses the lobby to the men's room.

Grace at the sink. He pats running water on his damaged face

            and straightens the bandage.

the stall door opens and a man emerges. Lean and fierce, like

            an electric charge... CATFISH STANTON, 30.

            Grace FREEZES at the sight of Catfish, tightening his belt.

            Lets the water run...
Grace? That you?
Catfish steps close, reaches a hand to Grace's face.

dialogue.text: Catfish steps close, reaches a hand to Grace's face.

segments.content: 'The hell happened?
Grace flinches. Catfish pauses, then SNIFFS his hand.
(smiles)
Catfish steps to the sink. Begins washing his hands.

dialogue.text: Catfish steps to the sink. Begins washing his hands.

segments.content: So where you off to?
Goin' to visit my mother. She's real
sick.
That's too bad. So you'll be gone a long
time then.
Another MAN suddenly enters. Large and imposing, neck tattoos ...BUZZ MCKINNON, 32.

dialogue.text: Another MAN suddenly enters. Large and imposing, neck tattoos ...BUZZ MCKINNON, 32.

segments.content: (swallows hard)
Catfish turns off the water. THE BATHROOM IS SUFFOCATED WITH SILENCE.

dialogue.text: Catfish turns off the water. THE BATHROOM IS SUFFOCATED WITH SILENCE.

segments.content: What can I do y'all for?
How come the Wheeler brothers, is locked
up? And you ain't?
Wheeler brothers is locked up? I don't
know nothin' about that.
Catfish GRINS. It's harsh. Blood curdling.
I heard different.
Well there ain't no "different" to hear,
Catfish. 'Cause I ain't talked to neither
of 'em.

Buzz moves. Grace turns to look... ...In a blink, Catfish's gun comes up: ONE QUICK POP. A .45 with a thick, barrel silencer. The mirror shatters. Grace's knees hit the floor. His head hits the sink, HOLDS. As blood runs from one small hole. Catfish straightens up in the next mirror. Tucks his shirt. Grace's body sags to the floor. Catfish and Buzz walk out. INT. EAST BATON ROUGE PARISH PRISON - DAY LOUD BUZZER. Two GUARDS #1 and #2 march Jesse down the tier. On his left, PRISONERS in cells, TURN, STARE and WHISPER. Jesse arrives at a cell.

character.name: But you did talk to someone.

dialogue.text: Buzz moves. Grace turns to look... ...In a blink, Catfish's gun comes up: ONE QUICK POP. A .45 with a thick, barrel silencer. The mirror shatters. Grace's knees hit the floor. His head hits the sink, HOLDS. As blood runs from one small hole. Catfish straightens up in the next mirror. Tucks his shirt. Grace's body sags to the floor. Catfish and Buzz walk out. INT. EAST BATON ROUGE PARISH PRISON - DAY LOUD BUZZER. Two GUARDS #1 and #2 march Jesse down the tier. On his left, PRISONERS in cells, TURN, STARE and WHISPER. Jesse arrives at a cell.

segments.content: (calls out)
BARS slide back. Jesse walks in. His CELL-MATE steps cautiously from the shadows... IT'S RAY. Pale and nervous. Jesse stands over him. The brothers' eyes connect. And there's a moment...

dialogue.text: BARS slide back. Jesse walks in. His CELL-MATE steps cautiously from the shadows... IT'S RAY. Pale and nervous. Jesse stands over him. The brothers' eyes connect. And there's a moment...

locations: EXERCISE YARD, EAST BATON ROUGE PARISH PRISON
heading.raw_text: EXT. EXERCISE YARD, EAST BATON ROUGE PARISH PRISON - DAY

segments.content:
High stone walls topped with concertina wire. Looming guard

            towers. Thick FOG blankets the yard filled with CONVICTS.

            Jesse takes hold of a metal bar, lifts it from a bench press.

            He does two reps. The weights BANG down and Jesse sits up.
Ray adds weight to the already excessive amount. He sweats as he talks nervously over Jesse's shoulder...

dialogue.text: Ray adds weight to the already excessive amount. He sweats as he talks nervously over Jesse's shoulder...

segments.content: There's eyes everywhere. Like I got a
sign on my back, Jesse, they all think I
talked.
Jesse scans numerous WHITE CONS watching the Wheeler brothers.
Just the other day... some spic fish got
hit with a weight. Ten other cons, they
beat him and stabbed him till there
weren't nothin' left. And the guards let
it happen.
Ray fastens the safety collars and Jesse leans back.
His brains were on the wall, Jesse. Like
somebody painted 'em.
Jesse does another set. Weights BANG down. He slowly sits up.
They come at you?
Not yet... But it's in the mail. I can
feel it fuckin' coming.
Ray shoots a look at a group of ARYAN BROTHERS across the
yard. CZAPP, their "leader," and ROACH. Jesse turns. Czapp
looks at him. Eyes meet. Jesse leans back.
The press shakes as Jesse does a last set. His red strained
face as the bar lands with a CRASH.

locations: YARD CORRIDOR, EAST BATON ROUGE PARISH PRISON
heading.raw_text: INT. YARD CORRIDOR, EAST BATON ROUGE PARISH PRISON - DAY,

segments.content:
A long line of prisoners are filing back through the gate.

            Ray, behind Jesse. Says low:
Hey, Jesse...
(silence)
Sorry I put you back here. I never meant--
(turns)
"Sorry", Raymond...? You ain't sorry.
(pause)
I took you into my home. I tried to clean
you up. And you steal from me...? You
take my fuckin' diamonds?
(dead to rights)
'Cause of you, I missed the birth of my
son.
Ray swallows hard. Nothing he can say.

locations: METRO OFFICE, EAST BATON ROUGE PARISH PRECINCT
heading.raw_text: INT. METRO OFFICE, EAST BATON ROUGE PARISH PRECINCT - DAY

segments.content:
CLOSE ON numerous files of ARYAN GANG MEMBERS. Arrest sheets,

            paperwork and photos.
Alright, let's work this...
(beat)
In prison, Wheeler is credited for the
expansion of the Brotherhood. When
Federal split up members, they had to
reorganize. So they tattooed their blood
types and serial numbers on one another.
Recede and multiply.
REVEAL NOW Bud and Shepard with Cobb and Marandino around a table, used as a converted eating area.

dialogue.text: REVEAL NOW Bud and Shepard with Cobb and Marandino around a table, used as a converted eating area.

segments.content: Put 'em in prison, they get stronger.
Everywhere you send one, they recruit in
numbers. Within five years, their numbers
were over ten thousand.
Shepard is flipping through a worn, thick file.

dialogue.text: Shepard is flipping through a worn, thick file.

segments.content: What do you got there, Shep'?
Interpol wired us files on three known
Aryan leaders in the state of Louisiana:
Edgar Bingham. Harold Kay. And this
man... Lucian Adams.

heading.raw_text: He opens the file, revealing mugshots of LUCIAN ADAMS, 51.

segments.content: Dark eyes. Sharp, gun metal features.
High priest of the Aryan National Party.
His "ministry" of Christian Identity and
Paramilitary Order has stood for over a
decade. Check this out...

heading.raw_text: Shepard pulls an old, faded surveillance photo: (Long shot)

segments.content: Lucian talking to a young Jesse outside a compound.
Wheeler was just seventeen when he met
Lucian at the Patriotic Congress.
No shit.
Today, Lucian's one hell of an
entrepreneur. Owns surplus stores.
Demolition. A piping business. Got trucks
runnin' all across the God damn country.
Bud's been quiet; says now:
Stay focused. Get back to Wheeler... I
For what? If Wheeler ever flipped, news
would spread like wildfire. The AB's
gonna know about it. They'd gonna know
about it nationally.
(re: his coffee)
Marandino does.

dialogue.text: Marandino does.

segments.content: That's if he was a surface informant. I
don't want him to testify. I want to keep
him on the street.
(to the group)
Look, this guy's been in it a long time.
He's up to his elbows; wants to shake his
hands free. I can feel it.
Braddock ain't gonna go for this.
Everyone looks to Bud.

dialogue.text: Everyone looks to Bud.

segments.content: We got one chance here. 'Cause if this
falls short... Jesse Wheeler's worth more
dead than alive.

locations: CAFETERIA, EAST BATON ROUGE PARISH PRISON
heading.raw_text: INT. CAFETERIA, EAST BATON ROUGE PARISH PRISON - EVENING

segments.content:
A sea of tables divided by race as far as the eye can see.  

            Jesse and Ray, trays in hand, find an island of ARYAN

            PRISONERS. They quickly part to make room for Jesse to sit.

            Suddenly Czapp and Roach arrive with their trays and abruptly

            sit across from the Wheeler brothers.
How you doin', Ray?
(off Ray's look)
We was just over there wonderin' why you
ain't got the courtesy to introduce us to
your kin.
I was gonna.
(grins)
Czapp locks on Jesse, who calmly eats, not looking up.

dialogue.text: Czapp locks on Jesse, who calmly eats, not looking up.

segments.content: Jesse Wheeler. Heard of you...
Fuckin-A, heard a lot.
Name's Czapp... You can call me,
"Bossman."
(beat)
I kept an eye on your brother the past
few days for you. Ain't that right, Ray?
(low)
Yeah...
My brother ain't none of your business.
Ain't none of my business, "Bossman." And
everything in this fuckin' place is my
business.
Ray nervously glances down at several Aryans watching...
(to Jesse)
Listen to me, you sonofabitch. I'm gonna
make one God damn thing God damn clear.
Your reputation is smoke. Whatever they
say you is or once was, I don't give a
flyin' fuck. 'Cause it's my say-so now.
Czapp looks away from Jesse and shouts down the table:

character.name: And your fuckin' brother's up for grabs.

dialogue.text: Czapp looks away from Jesse and shouts down the table:

segments.content: Suddenly Jesse SPRINGS. A headbutt EXPLODES Czapp's nose and throws him back. Czapp's head hits linoleum, echoing with a CRACK!! He lies still. Bloodied and unconscious.

dialogue.text: Suddenly Jesse SPRINGS. A headbutt EXPLODES Czapp's nose and throws him back. Czapp's head hits linoleum, echoing with a CRACK!! He lies still. Bloodied and unconscious.

segments.content: (stumbles away, shocked)

A DEAFENING SILENCE SPREADS OVER THE CAFETERIA. Jesse calmly resumes eating. Czapp's blood covers his face. SUDDENLY AN ALARM BLARES. GUARDS pour in, led by Murphy. INMATES HIT THE DECK, arms behind their heads. All except Jesse, who continues to eat.

dialogue.text: A DEAFENING SILENCE SPREADS OVER THE CAFETERIA. Jesse calmly resumes eating. Czapp's blood covers his face. SUDDENLY AN ALARM BLARES. GUARDS pour in, led by Murphy. INMATES HIT THE DECK, arms behind their heads. All except Jesse, who continues to eat.

segments.content: WHEELER!!! Stand the fuck up! Hands
behind your head!
Jesse rises.
Hands behind your head! Get on the
fuckin' floor!
Jesse puts his hands behind his head, but does not kneel.
Restraints are slammed on Jesse's wrists. And we...

locations: ISOLATION, EAST BATON ROUGE PARISH PRISON
heading.raw_text: INT. ISOLATION, EAST BATON ROUGE PARISH PRISON - LATE NIGHT

segments.content:
The door unlocks and drags open. Jesse turns, blinking

            painfully into the light ...Sees an imposing DUTY GUARD.
INT. GUARD STATION Jesse is led in. Duty Guard hits an extension button on a desk phone and offers the receiver... Jesse doesn't move.

dialogue.text: INT. GUARD STATION Jesse is led in. Duty Guard hits an extension button on a desk phone and offers the receiver... Jesse doesn't move.

segments.content: Duty Guard walks out. Alone now, Jesse picks up the line...

dialogue.text: Duty Guard walks out. Alone now, Jesse picks up the line...

segments.content: (into phone)
A low, whiskey voice is HEARD over the line: LUCIAN ADAMS.

dialogue.text: A low, whiskey voice is HEARD over the line: LUCIAN ADAMS.

segments.content: Jesse shuts his eyes. There's a moment before he opens them.

dialogue.text: Jesse shuts his eyes. There's a moment before he opens them.

segments.content: Read about the arrest, Jesse. There's a
lot of heat on this one.
I don't want my brother touched.
(laughs faintly)
I ain't callin' about your brother. I'm
callin' about you...
Jesse turns SLOW to find the Duty Guard watching him from the
hall. Lights a cigarette, stares.
You should have come to me sooner, Jesse.
None of this would have happened.
I'm askin' you, Lucian. My brother ain't
a problem.
And Jesse's quiet... Dead quiet...

dialogue.text: And Jesse's quiet... Dead quiet...

segments.content: And Jesse... We may know what you can do.
Jesse hesitates, then Lucian hangs up. DIAL TONE. INT. BRADDOCK'S OFFICE - LATE NIGHT Room strewn with piles of casework. Bud, agitated, paces. Braddock, behind a desk.

character.name: But you know what we can do. Understand?

dialogue.text: Jesse hesitates, then Lucian hangs up. DIAL TONE. INT. BRADDOCK'S OFFICE - LATE NIGHT Room strewn with piles of casework. Bud, agitated, paces. Braddock, behind a desk.

segments.content: You're reachin', Bud. The leverage ain't
there.
It's there. It's gotta cook a little
longer, that's all.
Jesse won't so much as blink at doin'
life. The fuckin' guy didn't rise in the
ranks 'cause he skirts under pressure.
(beat)
There's no deal to be had.
C'mon, Mike, you know what's goin' on.
Ray Wheeler compromised Jesse. By that,
he compromised the Brotherhood. Don't
tell me there ain't no fuckin' leverage.
Bud pours himself a cup of coffee.
We need somethin' more.

INT. VISITOR'S GATE, EAST BATON ROUGE PARISH PRISON - DAY Lynn, dark pouches under her eyes, goes through security check. INFANT SON in her arms. VISITING AREA Wives, girlfriends and lawyers talk to prisoners. TABLE Lynn, dark pouches under her eyes, holding their son, across from Jesse...

character.name: Well we ain't sleepin' till we find it.

dialogue.text: INT. VISITOR'S GATE, EAST BATON ROUGE PARISH PRISON - DAY Lynn, dark pouches under her eyes, goes through security check. INFANT SON in her arms. VISITING AREA Wives, girlfriends and lawyers talk to prisoners. TABLE Lynn, dark pouches under her eyes, holding their son, across from Jesse...

segments.content: Life. You know how fuckin' long that is,
Lynn's hands are shaking.

dialogue.text: Lynn's hands are shaking.

segments.content: So what am I supposed to do? Wait? Run?
(upset)
Your friends are comin' by the house.
Askin' questions, hangin' around. Waitin'
for the God damn phone to ring.
Jesse is silent.
You said we were done with this. That
they were out of our lives.
The baby begins to CRY.
We have no money, Jesse. Which means we
have no fucking food. ...Say something,
would you?
It's gonna be okay.
The baby WAILING now.

character.name: I'm afraid. I'm afraid for my life...

dialogue.text: The baby WAILING now.

segments.content: (quietly crying)
...For our baby.
TIGHT ON JESSE, for the first time, appearing powerless.
As Lynn wipes tears, trembling in her seat, Jesse looks away
from his son, and glances up...
Behind a glass partition outlying the room, a MAN is watching
them...
BUD. Stark still. Fixing Jesse with a hard stare.

locations: PROPERTY ROOM, EAST BATON ROUGE PARISH PRISON
heading.raw_text: INT. PROPERTY ROOM, EAST BATON ROUGE PARISH PRISON - LATER

segments.content:
A CLERK passes Lynn her belongings through chain link. She

            wipes her eyes, holding the baby.

            The back bay doors open. Bud enters. Sleepless, wrinkled

            clothes.
Lynn Wheeler. We haven't been properly
introduced. I'm Detective Bud Carter.
I know who you are.
You have a ride home?
Bud peels a few bills from a fold, puts it on the counter.

dialogue.text: Bud peels a few bills from a fold, puts it on the counter.

segments.content: Bud lays his card atop the bills, looks at Lynn.

dialogue.text: Bud lays his card atop the bills, looks at Lynn.

segments.content: 'You need anything...anything at all. Be
sure to call me.
They look at each other. She pulls her baby close. There's an
unspoken moment. And Bud walks away...
Lynn waits till Bud is out of view. Then takes the money. And
the card.

locations: CELLBLOCK, EAST BATON ROUGE PARISH PRISON
heading.raw_text: INT. CELLBLOCK, EAST BATON ROUGE PARISH PRISON - DAY

segments.content:
A Guard buzzes Jesse through.

            PRISONERS line the tier. Smoking cigarettes. Looking out.

            Jesse walks past, enters...

...where Ray sleeps in shadow on the bottom bunk.

            Jesse pulls a Polaroid from his pocket: His infant son. He

            gazes at the photo for a beat, then brings it to Ray...
No response. Jesse nudges his brother's shoulder.

dialogue.text: No response. Jesse nudges his brother's shoulder.

segments.content: Jesse rolls him over. Ray is limp. A filthy SYRINGE imbedded his arm. Jaw slack. Eyes wide and vacant. THE PHOTO FLUTTERS FROM JESSE'S HAND TO THE FLOOR... Jesse lowers, pulling Ray to his arms. He shuts his eyes. Teeth clench. And as Jesse feels the bile rising, his massive frame begins to shake... Then we realize, he's crying...

dialogue.text: Jesse rolls him over. Ray is limp. A filthy SYRINGE imbedded his arm. Jaw slack. Eyes wide and vacant. THE PHOTO FLUTTERS FROM JESSE'S HAND TO THE FLOOR... Jesse lowers, pulling Ray to his arms. He shuts his eyes. Teeth clench. And as Jesse feels the bile rising, his massive frame begins to shake... Then we realize, he's crying...

locations: LOADING DOCK, EAST BATON ROUGE PARISH PRISON
heading.raw_text: EXT. LOADING DOCK, EAST BATON ROUGE PARISH PRISON - DUSK

segments.content: Pouring rain. Ray's corpse is loaded onto an ambulance.
Jesse sits in shadow. Alone. And it's still...

Jesse sleeps. Hand under the pillow. When there's a sound...

            His eyes SNAP OPEN to discover the silhouettes of SIX MEN,

            rushing into his cell...

            A LOADED SOCK swings out from Jesse's pillow, slams MAN #1 in

            the jaw with a CRACK!!

            On his feet, Jesse whips the sock around and whacks MAN #2's

            head against the concrete wall. He slumps down unconscious.

heading.subject: into Jesse's sternum. Another shot
heading.raw_text: A BLUNT OBJECT is rammed into Jesse's sternum. Another shot

segments.content:
bangs his neck. The sock drops and a PADLOCK clatters out.

            With a final burst of energy, Jesse turns, SCREAMS and rushes

            MAN #3. Man #3 slams into the cell bars. CLANG!! Lights out.

            The remaining three Men attack. A series of blows rain down

            and Jesse sinks into their grip.

heading.subject: HALL LIGHTS BUMP ON: NOW WE SEE, THESE "MEN" ARE GUARDS.
heading.raw_text: HALL LIGHTS BUMP ON: NOW WE SEE, THESE "MEN" ARE GUARDS.

segments.content:
More GUARDS pour in, led by Murphy. They yank Jesse from his

            cell and take him down the tier.

            Guards toss the cell in a thorough search. Mattress

            overturns. Shelves crash.

PRISONERS move to their bars, SHOUTING and JEERING as Jesse

            is wrestled down the STAIRS to...

Jesse thrashes violently as the Guards slam him through a

            door into...

between cell blocks. The ROAR of prisoners recedes as Jesse's

            dragged into darkness getting darker.

locations: READY ROOM, EAST BATON ROUGE PARISH PRISON
heading.raw_text: INT. READY ROOM, EAST BATON ROUGE PARISH PRISON

segments.content:
...THERE'S A FLASH OF LIGHT. We're in a windowless room.

            And Bud pouring coffee for two...
Jesse is handcuffed to the table. Guards are breathing hard.

dialogue.text: Jesse is handcuffed to the table. Guards are breathing hard.

segments.content: MOTHERFUCKER! This how you do things?
Yeah... When I want to talk to someone,
without giving the impression he's
cooperatin'.
Jesse pauses, caught by Bud's tactics. The Guards file out
and shut the door.
Jesse's eyes are fierce and watching Bud's every movement as
he hands him a coffee, then takes a seat...
You got a problem.
Yeah, what's that?
To start with, you're lookin' at two
hundred years.
I've done the time. I'll do it again.
I know you can do it. But can your
family?
Jesse's face is tense. Unyielding.
Your brother's dead, Jesse. As we're
sittin' here now, he's on a slab at St.
Gabriel's Morgue. The coroner's callin'
it, "suicide". You and I both know that's
a load of shit.
(beat)
You do the time-- sure. And you never see
your kid. 'Cept in here. You can recruit
him. Your wife...plans...everything...
Gone.
(beat)
'Less you talk...to me.
Jesse silent, a dark internal pause. He meets Bud's eyes
across the table; then...
Do you hate?
Jesse's sudden directness has caught Bud off-guard.

dialogue.text: Jesse's sudden directness has caught Bud off-guard.

segments.content: Who do you hate the most? Blacks you
throw in prison?
...I dislike what they represent in the
system. Not as a whole.
And Jesse begins to consciously or unconsciously "preach."
And you believe that by overthrowin'
Aryan nationalism and integratin'
races...polluted creeds, with us...You
believe you're solvin' somethin'?
I believe we survive by integrating
safety. Understanding hate, and how to
stop it.
It ain't evil to fight it. It's evil to
tolerate it.
(leans in)
Maybe you forget that, to justify what
you do for a living...
Are we still in prison, or we back at the
compound, havin' mass?
You don't get it.
No, don't dictate to me what put you in
here, or question my intentions with your
overcooked revolution!
(beat)
'Fact, I think you wanted out 'fore I
even got to you! That's why you distanced
yourself. That's why you're out there
crackin' safes. Lookin' to live a life
that ain't AB.
In who I am, there's pressure! I work for
you, I won't need a lawyer, I'll need a
priest! My outside finance is gone... My
wife and son, their heads wind up
somewhere their bodies ain't! So tell me,
why the fuck should I get involved with
you?!
How about personal warranty?
Warranty?!
Yeah, that's right! You've been a part of
the problem so long, you've forgotten
what the fuck that is!
(boaring in)
"Finance..." Your wife came here on a bus
to see you. I sent her home in a cab. Is
that your outside fuckin' finance?!
Beat. Jesse, taken back.
Let me give you a little insight, pal. As
to what I know... And what you think you
know.
Bud flips open a file and shoves a series of grainy B&W
SURVEILLANCE PHOTOS in front of Jesse.
Photo #1: Outside Jesse's House. A distressed Lynn and the baby being led into a car by Catfish.

dialogue.text: Photo #1: Outside Jesse's House. A distressed Lynn and the baby being led into a car by Catfish.

segments.content: Is that your house? That's your wife,
right? Who's this guy?
(off Jesse's look)
Know where he's takin' them? Takin' your
family? I got a pretty good fuckin' idea.
Photo #3: An anonymous duplex. Catfish escorting Lynn and the
baby inside, past several surly Aryans looking on.
Jesse finally averts his eyes...
Look at your wife, Jesse. Look at her
face. And your son. They look safe to
you?
(a moment)
I'm all you've got! I'm all your family's
got! And the longer you're in here,
they're up for grabs.
ON JESSE. The wheels turning. Burning. THE CAMERA MOVES IN...
So either you let that happen... Or I get
the judge to allow bond. This never sees
trial. And you work for me.
And that's where it hangs...
FADE IN: INT. COURTROOM, BATON ROUGE - DAY Jesse rises, wearing a suit. JUDGE PONDER, at the bench, presides over this arraignment hearing:

dialogue.text: FADE IN: INT. COURTROOM, BATON ROUGE - DAY Jesse rises, wearing a suit. JUDGE PONDER, at the bench, presides over this arraignment hearing:

segments.content: You stand accused of forty counts of
burglary, twenty nine counts of felony
theft, possession of illegal firearms,
possession or dealing in unregistered
weapons, possession of a controlled
substance, manufacture and possession of
incendiary devices, and seventeen counts
of receiving stolen goods... How do you
plead?
CUT TO DANIEL KIERSEY, 40s, sharp, confident, expensively
dressed. Jesse's attorney, rising:
Not guilty, Your Honor.
The DISTRICT ATTORNEY rises from his seat:

character.name: Let's hear the arguments for bail.

dialogue.text: The DISTRICT ATTORNEY rises from his seat:

segments.content: Your honor, this man is an habitual felon
as well as a flight risk. Our office has
overwhelming evidence that Mr. Wheeler is
not only guilty, but also a serious
threat to the community. The State
recommends that bail be denied.
Your honor, my client deserves a
reasonable bail. He has every intention
of appearing and answering to all these
false charges. In addition, he is the
sole provider for his wife and newborn
child, who would suffer undo hardship if
this man were incarcerated.
THE GAVEL BANGS DOWN. Kiersey shakes Jesse's hand. Smiles:

character.name: Bond is set at one million.

dialogue.text: THE GAVEL BANGS DOWN. Kiersey shakes Jesse's hand. Smiles:

segments.content: REVEAL BUD -- seated in back, watching the proceedings.

dialogue.text: REVEAL BUD -- seated in back, watching the proceedings.

heading.raw_text: INT. BEDROOM, JESSE'S HOUSE - PRE DAWN

segments.content: Lynn, asleep in bed...

Jesse stands, holding his son, quietly comforting him. When

            Jesse turns, WE SEE a .45 tucked in his back.
(answers)
STATIC; he listens, then:

dialogue.text: STATIC; he listens, then:

segments.content: (into phone)

EXT. BACKYARD, JESSE'S HOUSE - PRE DAWN Jesse steps through his fence into deep WOODS, to find a CAR waiting idyll on a dirt road. INT. CAR - PRE DAWN A HEAVY-SET MAN at the wheel. Jesse gets in as the headlights spin on and the car pulls away... EXT. SHIPYARD - PRE DAWN Dark. Eerie and desolate. The car arrives. Jesse steps out and disappears into the shadows of a towering crane. On the jetty, a nondescript MAN stands alone against the calm Mississippi. His back is to us. Jesse approaches, stands quietly beside him.

dialogue.text: EXT. BACKYARD, JESSE'S HOUSE - PRE DAWN Jesse steps through his fence into deep WOODS, to find a CAR waiting idyll on a dirt road. INT. CAR - PRE DAWN A HEAVY-SET MAN at the wheel. Jesse gets in as the headlights spin on and the car pulls away... EXT. SHIPYARD - PRE DAWN Dark. Eerie and desolate. The car arrives. Jesse steps out and disappears into the shadows of a towering crane. On the jetty, a nondescript MAN stands alone against the calm Mississippi. His back is to us. Jesse approaches, stands quietly beside him.

segments.content: We realize now...It's Bud.

dialogue.text: We realize now...It's Bud.

segments.content: Let's get somethin' straight. I ain't
here 'cause I'm scared. I done what I
did, 'cause certain people crossed the
line. They didn't keep their word.
They stand together, facing the liquid horizon...

dialogue.text: They stand together, facing the liquid horizon...

segments.content: I want a body, Jesse.

Bud finally looks at Jesse. EXT. BORROW PITS - DAWN A swamp area used as a mud retrieval source for the levy. Amite River. FOG OBSCURES NEARLY EVERYTHING. Jesse slowly emerges... Then Bud and Metro, on all sides, MAG- LIGHTS, FLAK JACKETS and SHOTGUNS. A DUFFEL BAG of SHOVELS. The sounds of the swamp are terrifying. Herons and bobcats. Boots hitting water. The buzz of a million mosquitos. SUDDENLY A RUSHING SOUND -- An ALLIGATOR shoves off the mire.

dialogue.text: Bud finally looks at Jesse. EXT. BORROW PITS - DAWN A swamp area used as a mud retrieval source for the levy. Amite River. FOG OBSCURES NEARLY EVERYTHING. Jesse slowly emerges... Then Bud and Metro, on all sides, MAG- LIGHTS, FLAK JACKETS and SHOTGUNS. A DUFFEL BAG of SHOVELS. The sounds of the swamp are terrifying. Herons and bobcats. Boots hitting water. The buzz of a million mosquitos. SUDDENLY A RUSHING SOUND -- An ALLIGATOR shoves off the mire.

segments.content: 'The fuck is that?
Cobb's light catches the tail whipping into the swamp.
Yard dog. Relax.
Jesse suddenly STOPS. LISTENS. BREATHES. Bud and Metro stare.

dialogue.text: Jesse suddenly STOPS. LISTENS. BREATHES. Bud and Metro stare.

segments.content: (directly to Bud)
Metro exchanges looks, ANXIOUS. Bud nods "okay".

dialogue.text: Metro exchanges looks, ANXIOUS. Bud nods "okay".

segments.content: Metro engulfed in fog. Picks and shovels rise and fall.
Bud excitedly descends the pit to scrape gravel from metal.

dialogue.text: Bud excitedly descends the pit to scrape gravel from metal.

segments.content: Jesse watches as a pair of STEEL DRUMS emerge. INT. STATE POLICE AUTOPSY ROOM - MID MORNING The "cold room". Bud and Braddock watch as two PATHOLOGISTS hose down the drums. The stench is horrible.

character.name: Clear it off! Come on, find the edges!

dialogue.text: Jesse watches as a pair of STEEL DRUMS emerge. INT. STATE POLICE AUTOPSY ROOM - MID MORNING The "cold room". Bud and Braddock watch as two PATHOLOGISTS hose down the drums. The stench is horrible.

segments.content: How long they been down there?
Jesse tells me six months.
Six months? Bud, they're biodegraded by
now. Fuckin' worm food.
We'll get an ID. Remember, we got the guy
who put 'em there.
BLOW TORCHES ROAR as Pathologists burn through the drums.
Sparks fly. The lids CRASH. Swamp water floods out... And
immersed within: two sore-covered, DECOMPOSING BODIES.
The room recoils from the fumes.

Lynn is putting dishes away. The baby nearby, sleeps quietly

            in a swing. Lynn gazes out the window...

Jesse is under the hood of his truck, fixing the engine...

            When a '71 Mustang, white-on-white, roars up the street. 

            Jesse glances over as the car pulls alongside the driveway.  

            It's CATFISH, at the wheel. A wolfish grin.
'Bout time to get a new truck there,
Jesse tightens a nut with a torque wrench, says nothing.

dialogue.text: Jesse tightens a nut with a torque wrench, says nothing.

segments.content: Good to see you out. A free man now.
What's goin' on, 'Fish?
On a Sunday drive, that's all. The good
glorious Louisiana mornin'.
Jesse EYES his .45 atop the engine block, within reach.
Say, Jesse... Lucian's askin' about you.
Jesse stays on the engine, never turns around.

character.name: Fact, a lot of people are.

dialogue.text: Jesse stays on the engine, never turns around.

segments.content: You tell him I'll come by.
(no longer smiling)

As Catfish drives away... We HEAR a series of photos being taken at high-speed. FREEZE FRAME to BLACK & WHITE. PULL BACK to a distant CONSTRUCTION TRAILER. Bud with a long lens camera, triggers snapshots. INT. DINER - DAY Greasy spoon, soul food joint. Trucker and labor patrons. Bud walks in, perplexed to find Braddock sitting with MARTIN FITCH (30), Deputy Chief of Staff for US Attorney General. Pressed suit. Young face. Out of his element.

character.name: That's good. I'll see you real soon then.

dialogue.text: As Catfish drives away... We HEAR a series of photos being taken at high-speed. FREEZE FRAME to BLACK & WHITE. PULL BACK to a distant CONSTRUCTION TRAILER. Bud with a long lens camera, triggers snapshots. INT. DINER - DAY Greasy spoon, soul food joint. Trucker and labor patrons. Bud walks in, perplexed to find Braddock sitting with MARTIN FITCH (30), Deputy Chief of Staff for US Attorney General. Pressed suit. Young face. Out of his element.

segments.content: Hey, Mike.
Bud, this is Special Agent, Martin Fitch.
He's down from Washington. With the
Attorney General.
Fitch offers his hand, smiles. Bud shakes.

dialogue.text: Fitch offers his hand, smiles. Bud shakes.

segments.content: Martin's gonna be soliciting Jesse's case
for a Federal sponsor.
How long you been with the Attorney
General, Fitch?
Bud looks at Braddock.

dialogue.text: Bud looks at Braddock.

segments.content: I want to assure you my education and
experience is more than adequate to
handle a case of this potential.
Fitch's smile drops as Bud stares him down.

dialogue.text: Fitch's smile drops as Bud stares him down.

segments.content: Why don't we get to the particulars?
Right. Alright.
(clears throat)
To get Jesse a federal sponsor, we need
something substantial. A bait. In the
Justice Department, we have this mission
statement... We decide who the target is,
what's the threat assessment, the cost
value, over what time table it's gonna
take place... Which target do we go after
first. We don't want to miss a big target
hitting a smaller target, you understand?
No.
Well, exposing bodies has limitations.
Those people are dead. We can't retrieve
their lives.
Bud blinks.
He means there might not be enough to
back Jesse.
Keep him on the street without
protection, he winds up dead.
What I'm saying is, we need fresh leads.
He'll need to present something that
separates him from those we're going to
arrest. If Jesse can't offer something
continuous... I'm afraid we can't be of
much help.
Bud stares at Fitch.
A WAITRESS in her 50s approaches.
Ready to order?
(cuts in)
Yes. I'll take a garden salad. Roquefort
on the side.
You'll take what?
(curt)
It's a dressing.
Well...we got ranch, thousand island and
oil. Which one you want?
Bud's chair SCRAPES back as he stands, stares hard at Fitch:
And walks out. EXT. PARKING LOT OUTSIDE DINER - DAY Bud stalks out to his car. Braddock follows, agitated. They say nothing till they reach the car.

dialogue.text: And walks out. EXT. PARKING LOT OUTSIDE DINER - DAY Bud stalks out to his car. Braddock follows, agitated. They say nothing till they reach the car.

segments.content: I set this up. Me and Jesse. If the Feds
want to help, that's fine. But not him.
What do you mean, "me and Jesse?" He's
not your partner, Bud. This case is
beyond our capacity. It requires
resources we don't have.
Bud unlocks the car. They stand, talking across the roof.
They ain't takin' us serious, Mike. They
send us some kid with a year under his
belt?! He don't even know what state he's
in... You want him in charge?!
You're God damn right I do! You're out on
a limb on this already, Bud! It's my job
to make sure you get back!
This is bullshit.
That may be. What it ain't, is open for
discussion.
Braddock walks away. Bud simmers a moment, gets in his car.

A bare room; nothing to tell us where we are. Jesse's on a

            stool. He runs his fingers down his mustache, grits his teeth.
Y'all wanna talk about crime? Well I
could tell y'all things. Names.
Locations. What boat is movin' what
drugs, which one is guns. Who's gonna get
cut up and why. ...But what I got to know
is, if 'n when I do this... If I wear
your dog collar... Y'all gonna do what's
right by me and keep my head from gettin'

heading.subject: shot the fuck off? 'Cause the truth is,
heading.raw_text: shot the fuck off? 'Cause the truth is,

segments.content: you need me. You ain't got enough cops
with enough sense or enough time, to
clear them crimes that already been
committed and will be.
(pause)
Y'all need me... I got the devil's
address.
REVERSE: We're in a HOTEL SUITE.
Shades down. Full of AGENTS: FBI, ATF, DEA, SECRET SERVICE.
Law enforcement everywhere. On the furniture, against the
wall, sitting on the floor. Staring at Jesse in silence.
Bud stands by the door with Braddock. And Fitch steps
forward, laughs nervously...
Okay, great... Thanks. Thank you, Jesse,
for that. And thank you, everyone for
attending...
(tight)
Uh, we all know why we're here. To solve
a matter of custody--
We'll protect you and your family, Jesse.
(to the room)
It's a federal matter, gentlemen. Those
bodies were transported over state lines.
An ATF AGENT #1 imposes:
Not so fast. Ammunition, grenades? This
man's house was a factory, for Christ's
sake. ATF is taking this.
Those murders were drug related. DEA's
got to do follow ups.
He was printing counterfeit money.
ARGUING ENSUES, Agents' voices step over one another. Fitch tries to take control. Jesse's been silent, until...

dialogue.text: ARGUING ENSUES, Agents' voices step over one another. Fitch tries to take control. Jesse's been silent, until...

segments.content: Fitch hears this. He turns, loudly to the room...

dialogue.text: Fitch hears this. He turns, loudly to the room...

segments.content: Wait! Wait a minute, quiet! Everyone
quiet!
And EVERYTHING stops. Fitch moves to Jesse:
A what?
A hit list. There's much as twelve. Might
be one or two less now, I ain't sure.
Some could've already been gotten.
(to Braddock)
FBI #2 approaches Jesse...

dialogue.text: FBI #2 approaches Jesse...

segments.content: Why these twelve, Jesse?
Different reasons. It ain't so much why
or what they done that matters. Pick any
one of 'em off that list, AB puts you on
salary.
Everyone is suddenly interested. Bud sees this.
And you, sir, if I ain't mistaken...
Agents part, revealing JOHN NOKES(50s), black, an emminent figurehead in a plush suit. Surprised to be pointed out...

dialogue.text: Agents part, revealing JOHN NOKES(50s), black, an emminent figurehead in a plush suit. Surprised to be pointed out...

segments.content: First U.S. Attorney, John Nokes?
That's right.
Well, last time I seen it...you was
number two on that list.
It's quiet. Nokes thinks. Then LAUGHS and approaches Jesse.
Can you fill us in on the rest of those
names, Jesse?
Yes, I can. But there's something I gotta
make clear 'fore that happens.
What's that?
I've listened to you, Mr. Nokes. And I've
listened to these suits here, on who's
gonna take me in...
(beat)
I will die, go to hell and take all y'all
cocksuckers with me, if he--
(motions to Bud)
--tells me to.
(beat)
Jesse is explosive under the low projection delivery and a CHILL falls over the room.

character.name: I want y'all to know that.

dialogue.text: Jesse is explosive under the low projection delivery and a CHILL falls over the room.

segments.content: (to Bud)
Bud simply nods.

character.name: How's that fly by you, Lieutenant?

dialogue.text: Bud simply nods.

segments.content: I'll sponsor him. Jesse's welfare will
come out of our budget. Anyone has
pending cases or leads for Jesse, see me.
Jesse stares at Nokes. As the meeting settles back to a comfortable level...

dialogue.text: Jesse stares at Nokes. As the meeting settles back to a comfortable level...

segments.content: And, Jesse... I'm a little pissed I'm
number two on that list. Who the fuck is
number one?
The room erupts with LAUGHTER. Everyone except Bud and Jesse.

Jesse's truck moves over an old wooden bridge through

            sweeping fields that stretch to a vast, wooded area.

heading.raw_text: EXT. FRONT GATES, PRIVATE PROPERTY - DAY

segments.content:
Jesse stops at a long drive protected by locked iron gates.

            A surveillance camera zooms in. Jesse looks up. A second

            camera pans on Jesse, staring...

            MOVE IN as crackling, electronic pixels FILL THE FRAME and...

A BANK OF MONITORS showing Jesse at the gates. A GUARD sits

            in shadow, hits a button: We see the gates unlock and open.

pulls down the private road.

            Shafts of light mottle then burst, REVEALING an elegant

Jesse parks -- walks up the porch, where Catfish is relaxing,

            shoulder holster, revolver. And Buzz, cleaning a pistol.
Jesse nods, eyes Catfish.

dialogue.text: Jesse nods, eyes Catfish.

segments.content: Catfish grinds out his cigarette, gets to his feet.

dialogue.text: Catfish grinds out his cigarette, gets to his feet.

segments.content: He's busy right now; You can come in and
wait.
as Louis XIII pours to the rim. From elsewhere in the room:
This operation of your's has become big
business. You need relationships now more
than ever...
THE VOICE belongs to RICHARD MORRIS, 40s. He sits in a
leather chair, facing Lucian Adams, who's face we cannot see.
Seated next to Morris, is Daniel Kiersey.
...We've done business successfully
before, Mr. Adams. But it's a larger
scope now. I'm here today because I want
to represent you exclusively. You need
someone lobbying at a state level, as
well as in Washington. My organization
can provide both. We've got contacts that
you don't have and other people can't
get. Now, I'm aware that you have
multiple businesses... However you need
one go-to guy, so that all your ventures
stay coordinated and all transactions and
contracts are realized. I am that person,
LUCIAN'S HAND lifts the cognac out of frame, drinks.

character.name: Mr. Adams. That's what I do.

dialogue.text: LUCIAN'S HAND lifts the cognac out of frame, drinks.

segments.content: What's this going to cost us?
As a retainer, I want an advance of three
hundred-fifty thousand, along with ten
percent of whatever economic benefit I
bring to this organization.
Three-fifty? C'mon, Dick. That's out of
line.
If you want a quality global economic
plan, that's what you pay for--
We'll give you two, Mr. Morris...That's
what it's worth.
Morris goes suddenly silent, looks across at Lucian.
The advance is a drop in the bucket. The
real money is the percentage. It's in
your interest to see it my way.
Morris stares across the desk, several tense moments. Then:

INT. LIVING ROOM, LUCIAN ADAMS' HOUSE - DAY Morris emerges from the office. He glances at Jesse, then shrugs on his coat and leaves... Jesse looks back at the office doorway. FOLLOW Jesse in... INT. LUCIAN ADAM'S OFFICE ...past Kiersey, behind a massive desk in this impeccable room, we finally SEE LUCIAN ADAMS. Jesse is not invited to sit.

dialogue.text: INT. LIVING ROOM, LUCIAN ADAMS' HOUSE - DAY Morris emerges from the office. He glances at Jesse, then shrugs on his coat and leaves... Jesse looks back at the office doorway. FOLLOW Jesse in... INT. LUCIAN ADAM'S OFFICE ...past Kiersey, behind a massive desk in this impeccable room, we finally SEE LUCIAN ADAMS. Jesse is not invited to sit.

segments.content: (to Kiersey)
Kiersey walks out and shuts the door... ON LUCIAN he crosses slowly to a credenza, selects a clean shirt.

dialogue.text: Kiersey walks out and shuts the door... ON LUCIAN he crosses slowly to a credenza, selects a clean shirt.

segments.content: You have a son now, right?

As he removes the shirt he's wearing, REVEAL tattoos: BLACK SUN on his back. GERMAN RUNES, SS BOLTS, HRUNGNIR'S HEART. And around his stomach, a belt of NORSE GODS with the words, "INVISIBLE EMPIRE." Prison tats, dark and aged.

dialogue.text: As he removes the shirt he's wearing, REVEAL tattoos: BLACK SUN on his back. GERMAN RUNES, SS BOLTS, HRUNGNIR'S HEART. And around his stomach, a belt of NORSE GODS with the words, "INVISIBLE EMPIRE." Prison tats, dark and aged.

segments.content: What'd you name him?
Lucian, no emotion, puts on a pressed dress shirt, fastens cuff-links.

dialogue.text: Lucian, no emotion, puts on a pressed dress shirt, fastens cuff-links.

segments.content: (over his shoulder)
Heard the cops smacked you around inside.
'Wasn't too bad.
Lucian checks his hair.
You've been a busy man, Jesse. More ways
than one.
Looks like you done just fine without me.
And Lucian finally turns; looks at Jesse, eyes measuring...

dialogue.text: And Lucian finally turns; looks at Jesse, eyes measuring...

segments.content: Last I saw you, you asked for time. Time
to raise a family.
Time to straighten things out.
(pause)
I gave you that time... Then safe jobs
start poppin' up. Lafayette. New Orleans.
Clinton. Baton Rouge. All over. The boys,
they think it's niggers, gone widespread
on a hunt for pig's feet. But they all
professional. Burn jobs. Hot-weld oxygen.
Laid out, burned, laid back, perfect.
(locked on Jesse)
I knew right then and there, only a white
respectable burglar could've done this.
Jesse smiles slightly. They know each other well...
...When Lucian's smile suddenly drops. There's a flash of
controlled anger across his face; and WE FEEL a curtain of
tension fall heavily on the room.
Jesse... With all the work you been
doin': Diamonds. Emeralds. A dozen safe
jobs, behind my back...
(predatory)
Jesse he pulls from his pocket, a tiny pouch. Sets it on the desk... He pours the contents into Lucian's palm: DIAMONDS and EMERALDS.

character.name: Where's the tribute to the greater cause?

dialogue.text: Jesse he pulls from his pocket, a tiny pouch. Sets it on the desk... He pours the contents into Lucian's palm: DIAMONDS and EMERALDS.

segments.content: Lucian approaches the desk, opens the pouch: DIAMONDS and EMERALDS... A slow smile spreads across his face.

character.name: Like I said, I just needed time.

dialogue.text: Lucian approaches the desk, opens the pouch: DIAMONDS and EMERALDS... A slow smile spreads across his face.

segments.content: Well, even prophets stumble once in a
while.
Lucian embraces Jesse. Tight. Then, softly in his ear:

As they part, their eyes meet. Something passes between them... I/E. JESSE'S TRUCK, TRAVELING - BACK ROAD - NIGHT Jesse at the wheel, glances nervously in the rearview. Lynn in the passenger seat, baby in her lap. They're driving under the cover of darkness...

character.name: It's a shame about your brother.

dialogue.text: As they part, their eyes meet. Something passes between them... I/E. JESSE'S TRUCK, TRAVELING - BACK ROAD - NIGHT Jesse at the wheel, glances nervously in the rearview. Lynn in the passenger seat, baby in her lap. They're driving under the cover of darkness...

segments.content: I don't understand. Why do we have to
leave the state? You're not tellin' me
something. You're not tellin' me a lot.
It ain't safe here no more. You wanted
out? This is out.

Marandino looks through BINOCULARS: As an electric fence

            slides back. Jesse's truck approaches, drives through.

A twin-engine PLANE idylls. Lines of blue lights, strobe like

            rivers, air traffic above... And Bud, leaning against a

            nearby car with Shepard and Cobb.

            Jesse helps Lynn and the baby from his truck. Together, they

            walk toward the plane...

            Bud, watching from a distance, nods to Lynn.

Jesse and Lynn stare at each other. She's crying as he pulls

            her close, one arm around the baby. He says something to them

            we cannot hear...

            Then with the baby, Lynn boards her plane. An AGENT shuts the

            door. The engine SCREAMS to life, taking off...

            Jesse turns to shield his face. Lights STROBE and BLAST...

            Then, ABRUPT DARKNESS AND SILENCE...
now alone on the tarmac. Bud approaches; then...
Lucian took the stones. Talked about
jobs. High-end, boxcar.
Your family's safe now.
(beat)
Let's go to work.

Several AB SOLDIERS stand watch as Jesse pushes a heavy, 10"

            drill through a jeweler's vault door... Jesse throws tumbler

            and relock mechanisms aside, reaches in... jewels, gems.

heading.raw_text: EXT. PARKING LOT - BETWEEN CARS - NIGHT

segments.content: Bud and Jesse parked next to each other, trading info.

AB counterfeiting bills... Printing press and metal plates...

            Hands stain bills with coffee grounds and cigarettes, then

            industrial dryers... Jesse at a table behind tall stacks of

            cash, inspecting, approving...

Bud with Jesse. Info, names and written amounts.

            INSERTS: HANDS file serial numbers off guns... HANDS building

            silencers... loading guns in suitcases below false bottoms...
Jesse on the line... Bud on the other end, taking notes...

AB Soldiers unload crates from trucks, "Chrysler Corp."...

            "Remington Firearms"... Antique furniture... Machinery...

            INSERT: A MONEY MACHINE counts large denominations of cash.
Parked under the interstate. Bud looks over Jesse's info.

A large fishing boat arrives. Numerous Fisherman load marlin

            onto refrigerated trucks... Catfish, Buzz, numerous AB start

            up the trucks... Jesse hands the Head Fisherman a canvas bag

            of cash... 

            PULL BACK to reveal Shepard, Cobb and Marandino on the roof

            of a neighboring port, snapping photos. Taking notes.

Trucks arrive. AB bring the marlin inside... Atop a crate,

            Jesse slices a marlin open, revealing kilos of cocaine. More

            marlins are cut. More cocaine.

Bud on the typewriter, hammering out Jesse's contacts and

            movements. Files piling on his desk.

heading.raw_text: An organizational chart, as Bud pins AB mug shots, arrest

segments.content:
sheets and surveillance photos wall to wall.

            Bud steps back, observes. His case building. Getting huge.

heading.raw_text: EXT. BACK PATIO, LUCIAN'S HOUSE - DAY

segments.content: Wood secluded. Lucian, Jesse and Kiersey sit around a table.
There's a variety of matters to discuss
today, gentlemen. Eddie Moran's trial
starts next week. One of the jurors
reached out. He's asking six thousand up
front plus a job at four hundred a week.
That guarantees a hung jury with a push
for an acquittal.
Three hundred. Give him a no-show at the
trucking firm.
(as he writes)
Construction on the building Morris
brought us, in south-east Florida, is
complete. Every unit sold. We should see
revenues of one point four million over
our original projections.
Lucian lights a cigar, smoke curls from his lips.
Lastly, our "friends" from the Middle
East. They put a final offer on the
table. They'll fund our operation in
Louisiana if we agree to act on their
behalf. Political targets mostly, on the
basis of our approval...
(beat)
I advise we do a test case. Perhaps a
sample of their resources.
"Final offer?" Demands...
(beat)
Close the deal. We'll cook the cash for
it. By the time they realize, we'll have
our return.
(laughs to Jesse)
You believe they're travelin' all the way
to Louisiana just to get fuckin' robbed?

Jesse and Lucian walk together through green, expansive

            countryside. A pair of Arabian mares graze nearby.
I want you runnin' point on this one...
I'll be honest, I was hopin' for
somethin' bigger.
What do you got in mind?
How 'bout a few of them heads off the
list?
We got guys for that now. Catfish, Buzz.
What do you want to go back to that for?
The money's worth twice this. Bring back
a head it's fifteen grand; Bring a heart,
it's thirty, right?
Lucian looks at Jesse, who feels Lucian's scrutiny.
Tell you what. Do this other thing we got
lined up...
(beat)

Put a tap on that God damn lawyer's

Fitch, annoyed, but staying on track.

He's disconnected from everything, like a

Bud, cooling his heels. As the phones RING and RING...
A violent rainfall.

The door to one Freight truck rolls to the top, revealing a

Catfish, would you shut the fuck up? This

--You had to keep your mouth shut! On a

'The fuck off me--!
Jesse slams him back again. HOLDS his throat.
(low, deadly)
Fuck me up again, you hear me? I'll leave

PAUSE. Catfish glares, then concedes.
